metadata.title: CVE-2023-25746 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Memory safety bugs present in Firefox ESR 102.7. Some of these bugs showedevidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort someof these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. Thisvulnerability affects Thunderbird < 102.8 and Firefox ESR < 102.8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-25746` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
